pull_request.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

update.description:
Issue #38

This is the implementation for the soft labelling of segway semi-supervised mode.
Now you can specify soft label assignment in the supervision BED file.
If you have ```0``` as the name, it will be the same as it was.
But know you could make the name look like ```0:5``` to specify anything in the range ```[0,5) == 0,1,2,3,4```

Currently it only support soft assignment with the same width, but I'll add more complex support in future update once I realize how to add data structure in tmpl file.

This current version can't pass the unit test because it modified the segway.inc file structure. Since it took a while to change that I would only update the test case until we reach an agreement on what I changed here.
update.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

content.raw:
That's true. You may go the comment route. Though it is important to know that you only "need" the comma_pos for the case where you actually find the ":" in the first place. Afterwards you could split at the ":" or just get the `comma_pos` once in you know that it exists.

Also I just realized that the variable should be called `colon_pos` or `colon_positon` at the least. "," is a comma. ":" is a colon.
content.html:
That's true. You may go the comment route. Though it is important to know that you only "need" the comma_pos for the case where you actually find the ":" in the first place. Afterwards you could split at the ":" or just get the comma_pos once in you know that it exists.

Also I just realized that the variable should be called colon_pos or colon_positon at the least. "," is a comma. ":" is a colon.

content.raw: This is minor but you may want to assert that `end_label` is > `start_label`. This is just in case someone accidentally specifies in their bed files a reverse range (e.g. 5:0).
content.html: This is minor but you may want to assert that end_label is > start_label. This is just in case someone accidentally specifies in their bed files a reverse range (e.g. 5:0).

content.raw:
This one particular line, without inspecting what `modify_supervision_label_extension` does, is not at all obvious to what it's doing. There is a magic number of '1'. There needs to be a comment or a constant representing what the 1 is supposed to represent.

You may also want to consider modifying `modify_supervision_label` so that the default value for the first argument is always 1 so you don't even need to specify here (if it should be the default case).
content.html:
This one particular line, without inspecting what modify_supervision_label_extension does, is not at all obvious to what it's doing. There is a magic number of '1'. There needs to be a comment or a constant representing what the 1 is supposed to represent.

You may also want to consider modifying modify_supervision_label so that the default value for the first argument is always 1 so you don't even need to specify here (if it should be the default case).

content.raw:
A comment here might be helpful since it's not obvious that find returns -1 on failure. Or perhaps a more pythonic way of doing this for just the condition would be to write something like:
```python
if ":" in datum.name:
```
or in this specific case:
```python
if ":" not in datum.name:
```
But in general it's usually better to state the positive case first.
content.html:
A comment here might be helpful since it's not obvious that find returns -1 on failure. Or perhaps a more pythonic way of doing this for just the condition would be to write something like:

if ":" in datum.name:

or in this specific case:

if ":" not in datum.name:

But in general it's usually better to state the positive case first.

update.description:
Issue #38

This is the implementation for the soft labelling of segway semi-supervised mode.
Now you can specify soft label assignment in the supervision BED file.
If you have ```0``` as the name, it will be the same as it was.
But know you could make the name look like ```0:5``` to specify anything in the range ```[0,5) == 0,1,2,3,4```

Currently it only support soft assignment with the same width, but I'll add more complex support in future update once I realize how to add data structure in tmpl file.

This current version can't pass the unit test because it modified the segway.inc file structure. Since it took a while to change that I would only update the test case until we reach an agreement on what I changed here.
update.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label
